lines.text: Both your eyes are very pretty.
What's sauce for the gander is goose for the goose!
I'll call you Godfrey. It'll sound like I'm swearing.
One swallow doesn't make a summer, nor a drink either.
Such a fine looking body guard. Oh, I wish somebody like that was guarding my body.
You know this love thing causes so much trouble, you wonder what makes it so popular.
Keep the home fires burning, Abner.
Hey, there's a dame in here and is she pickled!
Say, listen, Mister. I'm tired. Will you please pay me off and let me go?
No-no-no-no. I like you. There's something refreshing about you. You're a little gasolini, but, refreshing.
Driver, put up your horse. We're in for the evening.
My name is Scott. I believe you know my father
Not Rufus Scott's son?
The same. Unless the old gentleman has been fooling me.
Oh, I remember. He told me once that you were either a genius in your own special line - or an idiot.
Ha-ha. Well I may be the former and being the former, I may be the later.

You see, a detective appears after the crime is committed. A deflector appears before the crime is perpetrated and deflects it. And the deflection is in direct ratio with the animus of the exciting body.
Oh, none of us know who we are!
Miss Latham, I can be trusted, up to a certain point.
That's what Pappy told Mammy.
Honey, my advice is to get off the train at the next stop, wherever it is. This is the biggest maybe trip I ever took.
What do you mean maybe trip?

Well, you're the daughter of a very wealthy man - maybe. Murray is a New York lawyer taking you to meet your father - maybe. Allen is in love with you and trying to protect your interests - maybe. Scott is a nut! Positively! I'm beginning to suspect Blake and, eh, I'm not even so sure of myself!
I'll see you in the morning.
Maybe.
Well, are you with him or is he with you?
No, we're all together. Couldn't we play a little something?
Just what would you like to play?
Well, Post Office? Kiss the Pillow? Puss in the Corner?
Out, please.
Well, I'm only trying to be sociable.
